Trial_Design.evidence: This study compared the analgesic effects of epidural tramadol versus morphine in six healthy cats.

Intervention.evidence: each cat received an epidural injection of saline 0.22 ml/kg (control treatment, CT), tramadol 1 mg/kg (tramadol treatment, TT), or morphine 0.1 mg/kg (morphine treatment, MT).

Method_Outcome.evidence: SDS, visual analog scale (VAS) and physiological parameters (respiratory and heart rate) were used to assess analgesia level to a noxious stimulus (base of the tail skin fold clamping) at 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 h post-epidural.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Group TT had a higher SDS and VAS score when compared to MT at 8, 10 and 12 h post-epidural.
